head.title: Play online with friends
head.description: Play Skyjo online with friends for free!

explanation.title: What is Skyjo?
explanation.content: Skyjo is an exciting card game and an excellent board game, enjoyed by games fans all over the world. This multiplayer card game is designed for a number of players ranging from 2 to 8, where each player receives 12 cards, initially hidden. The main aim of the game is to score as few points as possible. The game ends as soon as one player reaches 100 points. The rules of the game are simple and easy to understand, making it an ideal choice for game nights with family or friends. Game enthusiasts will be delighted to learn that it is now possible to play Skyjo online for free!

meaning.title: What does Skyjo mean?
meaning.content: A Skyjo is a column of 3 identical cards in the game.

how-to-play.title: How to play Skyjo?
how-to-play.content: To play Skyjo, deal 12 cards to each player face down. The goal is to have the fewest points possible by flipping and exchanging cards. Each turn, draw a card from the deck or discard pile, then decide to replace one of your visible cards. Numbered cards are worth their points, special cards have actions. The game ends when a player has flipped all their cards. The player with the fewest points wins. You can check <rules>the rules</rules> for more information.

how-to-win.title: How to win at Skyjo?
how-to-win.content: To win at Skyjo, it's essential to have the lowest score possible. To achieve this, adopt a balanced strategy between having the lowest cards, revealing your cards, and creating columns of identical cards. Avoid flipping first unless you're significantly ahead with visible cards. Remember to keep already visible cards to try to create columns with them, rather than optimizing them individually.

play-classic-with-action.title: Can you play classic Skyjo with Skyjo Action?
play-classic-with-action.content: Yes, you just need to remove the action cards. If you're playing the online version, select the classic version to play Skyjo.

initial-turned-count.label: Number of card turned at the beginning of a round
initial-turned-count.title: {number} cards will be turned at the beginning of the game

game-goal.title: Game goal
game-goal.content: The Skyjo game is played over several rounds and ends as soon as a player reaches 100 points or more. The player with the fewest points wins the game.

round-preparation.title: Round preparation
round-preparation.content-1: First, each player is dealt 12 cards face-down. Next, one card from the draw pile is placed face-up in the middle of the table, forming the beginning of the discard pile. The remaining cards are placed face-down next to each other and form the draw pile.
round-preparation.content-2: Each player places his 12 cards in four columns of three cards face down in front of him. Finally, each player turns face-up two cards of their choice.

round-start.title: Round start
round-start.content-1: The player can choose the first card turned over from the discard pile
round-start.content-2: or the first face-down card of the draw pile

choice-1.title: Choice 1:
choice-1.description: Take the first card from the discard pile.
choice-1.content: The player must immediately swap this card with one of his or her 12 cards and place it face up. He can choose freely between face-up and face-down cards. Hidden cards must not be must not be seen before the exchange. The exchanged card is placed face-up on the discard pile.

choice-2.title: Choice 2:
choice-2.description: Take the first card face down from the draw pile.
choice-2.content-1: The player can look at the card and choose whether to exchange it for one of his cards (hidden or visible) or discard it. If he wants to keep the drawn card, he exchanges it with one of his cards as described above in the
choice-2.content-2: If he does not wish to keep the drawn card, he places it on the discard pile and must turn face-up one of his cards.

round-start.end-of-turn: His turn is then over, and it's the next player's turn (clockwise).

special-rule.title: Special rule:
special-rule.content: If a player has 3 identical cards in a column, the player discards these 3 cards by placing them on the discard pile. If a column of identical cards is obtained by exchanging with a card from the draw pile or discard pile, the three identical cards identical cards must always be placed on the discard pile after the exchanged card.

round-end.title: End of the round
round-end.content-1: When a player has revealed all his cards, he has played his last turn.
round-end.content-2: All subsequent players play once more to complete the round.

scoring.title: Scoring
scoring.description: Players who still have cards face down turn them face up. Each player counts his total points.

list.content-1: If the total of points is positive, he adds it to the total of points from previous rounds.
list.content-2: If the total is negative, it is subtracted from the total points of the previous rounds.

first-to-finish.content: If the player who has completed the round (the 1st to have turned over all his cards) has not obtained, strictly speaking, the lowest number of points for that round, then the sum of his points for that round is doubled.

note.title: Please note:
note.content: this rule only applies to positive points!

example.title: Example:
example.content: Player A reveals all his cards and finishes the round. At the end of the round, he has 10 points, player B has 24 points and player C also has 10 points. As player A does not strictly have the lowest number of points, his points are doubled to 20.

end-of-game.title: End of game
end-of-game.content: At the end of each round, each player's points are added to the total score obtained in the previous rounds. The game ends as soon as a player reaches 100 points or more. The player with the lowest score wins the game.

turn.throwOrReplace: Replace a card or discard the drawn card
